intro: Mikania brevifaucia, commonly known as the short-throated mikania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Mikania brevifaucia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
